Main.TextJPN: 待ち合わせ場所には、もう沙都子と梨花ちゃんが待っていた。
Main.TextENG: Satoko and Rika-chan were already there waiting for me.

Main.TextJPN: 前髪に隠れた絆創膏が痛々しかったが、@k沙都子自身はすこぶる元気で、まるでその傷が、はしゃぎ過ぎた遊びの怪我か何かのような感じさえした。
Main.TextENG: While the injuries on her face (covered with band-aids) looked painful, Satoko seemed to be full of life.@k It almost looked as though her wounds were from playing too hard or something.

Main.TextJPN: 「じゃあ、昨夜は結局診療所に泊まったのか」
Main.TextENG: ``So you stayed at the clinic last night?``

Main.TextJPN: 「えぇ、私は全然平気ですのよって言ったんですけど、監督たちが一晩様子を見たいなんて仰りますもので」
Main.TextENG: ``Yes. I told him I was fine, but the coach wanted to keep an eye on me.``

Main.TextJPN: 「お医者さんがそうしろって言うんだから、素直に従った方がいいと思うけどなぁ」
Main.TextENG: ``If that's what the doctor said, then you should listen to him.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あはははは、わかったー。@k@vS12/03/280300002.診療所でひとりでお泊りするのが怖かったんでしょー！@k@vS12/03/280300003.　夜の診療所には成仏してない霊がいっぱいいるそうだからね～～！」
Main.TextENG: ``Ahahahaha, I see!@k@vS12/03/280300002. You were scared to stay at the clinic alone, weren't you?@k@vS12/03/280300003. I heard there are lots of ghosts inside hospitals!``

Main.TextJPN: 「……沙都子はボクと一緒でないと眠れない体になってしまったのですよ」
Main.TextENG: ``......Satoko can't sleep without me.``

Main.TextJPN: 「はぅ～！@k@vS12/02/280200002.　どうして一緒じゃないと眠れないのかな、かな！」
Main.TextENG: ``Hauuu!@k@vS12/02/280200002. Why can't you sleep without her? Why?``

Main.TextJPN: 「それはですね、@k@vS12/06/280600002.ひとりだと怖い夢を見てとんでもない寝言を、」
Main.TextENG: ``That's because...@k@vS12/06/280600002. Rika-chama is the only one who can give her comfort...``

Main.TextJPN: 詩音が何か妙なことを言い出そうとした瞬間、どこからともなくタライが飛んできて顔面に当たった。
Main.TextENG: No sooner had Shion finished that sentence than a bucket went flying into her face.

Main.TextJPN: そして始まる沙都子と詩音の追いかけっこ。
Main.TextENG: Satoko started chasing Shion in circles, like they were playing tag.

Main.TextJPN: そんなドタバタがものすごく懐かしい。
Main.TextENG: I really missed this rambunctious fun.

Main.TextJPN: 「こんな当り前の風景が、もう取り戻せないかもしれないって思ってた」
Main.TextENG: ``I thought I'd never see this again.``
``...I felt the same.@k@vS12/01/280100004. But we got it back.@k@vS12/01/280100005. We did this.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……主に頑張ったのは圭一だと思いますですよ。@k@vS12/05/280500003.圭一が相談所に訴えようと自分で言い出して、圭一がみんなで押し掛けようと言ってみんなに声を掛けたのです」
Main.TextENG: ``......I think you did the most.@k@vS12/05/280500003. It was your idea to go to the child consultation center, and you were the one who asked everyone for their support.``

Main.TextJPN: 「そうだねぇ。@k@vS12/03/280300005.圭ちゃんが最大の功労者であるのは私も認めるよ。@k@vS12/03/280300006.今回の一件で、雛見沢に前原圭一ありってのはだいぶ知れ渡ったと思うからねぇ！」
Main.TextENG: ``I agree.@k@vS12/03/280300005. I think Kei-chan contributed the most.@k@vS12/03/280300006. Most people in Hinamizawa know who Keiichi Maebara is by now!``

Main.TextJPN: 「はぅ。@k@vS12/02/280200005.圭一くん有名になってモテモテになっちゃうのかな、かなぁ…？」
Main.TextENG: ``Hau.@k@vS12/02/280200005. Is Keiichi-kun going to be a popular guy now? Is he?``

Main.TextJPN: 「そりゃあモテモテになるねぇ！@k@vS12/03/280300008.　婦人会のおばさま方にちやほやされちゃうよ。@k@vS12/03/280300009.いよ、モテる男は辛いねぇ！」
Main.TextENG: ``I bet he'll be incredibly popular!@k@vS12/03/280300008. Popular among old ladies, that is.@k@vS12/03/280300009. Ah, I really envy him!``

Main.TextJPN: そのおばさま方の年齢が３で割ればちょうどいいってのが泣けるけどな…。
Main.TextENG: I'd be fine with that if I could divide their ages by three...

Main.TextJPN: たくさんの人が浴衣姿ですれ違う。
Main.TextENG: Many people were wearing yukatas.

Main.TextJPN: こんなのを見てると、まだ６月なのにもう夏真っ盛りという気分になってくる。
Main.TextENG: It was still June, but it felt more like it was the middle of summer.

Main.TextJPN: 境内への階段を上がると、……そこは祭り一色だ。
Main.TextENG: Once we finished climbing the stairs, we could see the festival and the crowd enjoying it.

Main.TextJPN: 古手神社は以前来た時の様子からは想像もつかないくらいの大賑わいを見せていた。
Main.TextENG: The Furude Shrine was packed with people, leaving the grounds looking nothing like their usual, quiet self.

Main.TextJPN: 色とりどりの提灯が並び、連なる露店やそれに群がる人々の雑多な雰囲気が、とても心地よい。
Main.TextENG: Lanterns of various colors were hung about, and people were swarming the various festival booths, giving the whole place an unorganized yet pleasant atmosphere.

Main.TextJPN: 「すげぇ人だなぁ！！@k@vS12/01/280100007.　雛見沢ってこんなに人がいたんだ…」
Main.TextENG: ``What a crowd!!@k@vS12/01/280100007. I had no idea there were even this many people in Hinamizawa...``

Main.TextJPN: 「綿流しのお祭りはみんな来るよ。@k@vS12/02/280200007.多分、雛見沢の人の半分くらいは来てるんじゃないかな」
Main.TextENG: ``Everyone comes to this festival.@k@vS12/02/280200007. I think at least half of the population of the village is here.``

Main.TextJPN: 「それだけじゃないよ。@k@vS12/03/280300011.近隣の町の町会や子供会も招待してる」
Main.TextENG: ``There's more than just them.@k@vS12/03/280300011. The neighboring town councils and youth groups are invited too.``

Main.TextJPN: 「そうだよな。@k@vS12/01/280100009.俺たちの学校、あれしか生徒いないのに。@k@vS12/01/280100010.今日は子供の姿がやたらたくさんある」
Main.TextENG: ``I see.@k@vS12/01/280100009. We only have a few students in our school.@k@vS12/01/280100010. That explains why there are so many kids around today.``

Main.TextJPN: 「お祭りの賑やかさは、やっぱり子供の賑やかさだからね」
Main.TextENG: ``Hearing the happy cheers of children is the best part of the festival.``

Main.TextJPN: そうだよな。@k同感だ。
Main.TextENG: She's right.@k I'm in agreement there.

Main.TextJPN: 祭りの花の露店もたくさん出ていた。
Main.TextENG: There were lots of booths around too; they were by far the best part of the festival.

Main.TextJPN: たこ焼き、やきそば、カキ氷。あんず飴にソースせんべい、チョコバナナ。@kヨーヨーすくいに金魚すくい、射的屋と本当にいっぱいあり、それらにたくさんの人々が群がっていた。
Main.TextENG: Booths selling takoyaki, yakisoba, shaved ice, apricot candy, sauce senbei, chocolate bananas...@k There was a yo-yo game, a goldfish game, a shooting gallery... There were countless booths here.

Main.TextJPN: 「露天商は町からわざわざ来てくれてるんだよ。@k@vS12/03/280300014.やっぱりこういうのがないとお祭りは盛り上がらないよねぇ！！」
Main.TextENG: ``Those booth runners all came from the city.@k@vS12/03/280300014. You can't call it a festival without festival booths!``

Main.TextJPN: 「で、それを俺たちは荒して回るわけか。@k@vS12/01/280100012.…どんな勝負にせよ、俺は負けないぜ！！」
Main.TextENG: ``So we're going to have a battle in every one of them, huh?@k@vS12/01/280100012. I'm not going to lose today!``

Main.TextJPN: 「そうだね」
Main.TextENG: ``Yeah, same here.

Main.TextJPN: 「……えへへ…がんばろ！」
Main.TextENG: ...Heh heh... let's do it!``

Main.TextJPN: 「はろろーん！@k@vS12/06/280600004.　遅れて申し訳ないです。@k@vS12/06/280600005.私がビリでした？@k@vS12/06/280600006.　ならこれで全員揃いましたね！」
Main.TextENG: ``Y'ello!!@k@vS12/06/280600004. Sorry I'm late.@k@vS12/06/280600005. Am I the last one?@k@vS12/06/280600006. Everyone's here now, huh?``

Main.TextJPN: 「このメンバーが揃うと、のんびりお祭りを楽しもうということにはなりませんのねぇ！」
Main.TextENG: ``Once our club gets together, there's no way we can just sit back and enjoy the festival!``

Main.TextJPN: 「そりゃあそうだよ！！」
Main.TextENG: ``Of course not!!

Main.TextJPN: 「今年も行くよー！！@k@vS12/03/280300017.　綿流祭、えっと、６人か！」
Main.TextENG: We're doing it again this year!!@k@vS12/03/280300017. This Watanagashi festival, for this six of us...

Main.TextJPN: 「六凶爆闘ぉおぉ！！」
Main.TextENG: Will be the battle of six evils!!``

Main.TextJPN: 「……沙都子。@k@vS12/05/280500005.今年は気兼ねしないで、思いっきり楽しみましょうなのです」
Main.TextENG: ``......Satoko.@k@vS12/05/280500005. There's no reason to hold back this year. Let's enjoy the festival with all our might.``

Main.TextJPN: 「をっほっほっほ！@k@vS12/04/280400004.　頼まれなくても気兼ねなどしませんわ！@k@vS12/04/280400005.　大暴れさせていただきますのよー！！」
Main.TextENG: ``Oh ho ho!!@k@vS12/04/280400004. You don't even need to mention it!@k@vS12/04/280400005. I, too, declare that I will be the victor!!``

Main.TextJPN: 「よっしゃ、沙都子！@k@vS12/01/280100014.　その意気だぜ！！」
Main.TextENG: ``Yeah, Satoko!@k@vS12/01/280100014. You go, girl!``

Main.TextJPN: 「昨日までのことなんか、今夜で吹き飛ばしちゃいましょう！」
Main.TextENG: ``Let's put everything that happened before tonight behind us!``

Main.TextJPN: 「今日はみんなで思い切り遊ぼう！@k@vS12/02/280200011.　全員が揃うなんて一週間ぶりだもんね！」
Main.TextENG: ``Let's play with everything we've got!@k@vS12/02/280200011. It's been a good week since we all got together!``

Main.TextJPN: 「そうさそうさ！@k@vS12/03/280300020.　今夜は全員で祭りを遊び倒すよー！！」
Main.TextENG: ``Yeah, yeah!@k@vS12/03/280300020. Tonight we're all enjoying this festival to its fullest!!``

Main.TextJPN: 私たちが遊んで回る度に、@r大勢の人が沙都子に声を掛けてくれた。
Main.TextENG: As we ran around frolicking,@ra lot of people approached Satoko.

Main.TextJPN: ある人は沙都子の怪我を気遣い、@rある人は沙都子のこれまでに同情し、@rある人はこれからは何かあったら@r頼れと胸を叩いた。
Main.TextENG: Some were concerned for her injuries,@rSome sympathisized with how she had been treated so far, and some even insisted she could rely on them if ever in need.

Main.TextJPN: その全てが、@r沙都子にとってはくすぐったいくらいに@r新鮮だったに違いない。
Main.TextENG: And all of that,@rmust have been disconcertingly fresh,@rfor Satoko, who wasn't used to it.

Main.TextJPN: 沙都子はみんなが妙にやさしくて@rかえって気持ち悪いなんて言ってたが、@rそれは照れ隠しだ。
Main.TextENG: Satoko said that all unusual kindness@rwas making her feel uncomfortable instead,@rbut I knew she was just being shy.

Main.TextJPN: 今の沙都子にはこのくらいの方が、@r村が生まれ変わったことを実感できて@rちょうどいいに違いない。
Main.TextENG: Right now,@rthis was just what it took for Satoko@rto truly feel that the village has been reborn.

Main.TextJPN: 「おや皆さん、さっそくはしゃぎ回っているようですねぇ」
Main.TextENG: ``My, hello. You all seem to be enjoying yourselves.``

Main.TextJPN: 「やぁ、梨花ちゃん。@k@vS12/13/281300002.約束どおりに来たよ。@k@vS12/13/281300003.盛大に盛り上がってるね」
Main.TextENG: ``Hi, Rika-chan.@k@vS12/13/281300002. I'm here like I promised.@k@vS12/13/281300003. The festival sure has grown into a splendor.``

Main.TextJPN: 「どちら様でございますのかしら。@k@vS12/04/280400007.梨花の知り合いですの？」
Main.TextENG: ``Who's this guy?@k@vS12/04/280400007. You know him, Rika?``

Main.TextJPN: 「……赤坂は肝心な時にいなくて使えないのです」
Main.TextENG: ``......Akasaka is never there when I need him.``
``Huh?@k@vS12/13/281300005. What are you talking about?@k@vS12/13/281300006. Did I do something to make you upset...?``

Main.TextJPN: 「なっはっはっは。@k@vS12/11/280700003.実はですね、赤坂さんが温泉へ行かれているほんの一週間ほどの間にですね、とても大変なことがあったんです」
Main.TextENG: ``Na ha ha ha.@k@vS12/11/280700003. While you were at the hot springs with your wife, things sure got hectic around here.``

Main.TextJPN: 「はぅ、梨花ちゃんその人って、おもちゃ屋さんで会った人だよね？　よね？」
Main.TextENG: ``Hau, Rika-chan is talking with some strange older guy. I wonder if he's someone she knows. I wonder!``

Main.TextJPN: 「あ～、そういえば大石さんと一緒にいたね」
Main.TextENG: ``Ah, he was with Ooishi before!

Main.TextJPN: 「この人も警察の関係者さん～？」
Main.TextENG: Is he also from police?``

Main.TextJPN: 赤坂が来た時、私は運命を破るのは@r英雄的な個人の力によるものだと@r信じていた。@rでも結局、それは誤解だったわけだ。
Main.TextENG: When Akasaka had arrived, I'd believed what it took to change fate was the power of an influential individual.@rOr so I thought.@r@rBut it turned out that was a misunderstanding.

Main.TextJPN: 奇跡は個人が起こすんじゃない。@r全員で起こすもの。@rだから、赤坂が一人いてくれれば@r運命に勝てるというのは@r私の思い込みに過ぎない。
Main.TextENG: Individuals don't make miracles.@rEveryone must come forward to make them happen.@rThat's why when I thought I could defeat fate as long as I had Akasaka by my side一@rit was all in my head.

Main.TextJPN: 仮に側にいてくれたとしても、@r何もできなくて@r失望させられただけだったかもしれない。
Main.TextENG: Even if he had been there by my side,@rwe probably wouldn't have been able to do anything and would have only disappointed ourselves.

Main.TextJPN: 別に赤坂に非があるわけでも@r何でもないのに、@rそれに対して使えない、とは。
Main.TextENG: I'm not saying that Akasaka was at fault一@rthat's not the point at all.@rI may have even considered him \"useles\", perhaps. ...even I'm rather astonished at my foul-mouthedness.

Main.TextJPN: …自分の口の悪さに少し呆れる。@r今夜はそういう話は抜きだ。@r何十年ぶりかの再会を祝おうではないか。
Main.TextENG: Let's forget about such things tonight.@rIt's been a couple of decades一@rwhy not celebrate our reunion instead?

Main.TextJPN: 「おんや！@k@vS12/00/00000220.　前原の坊主じゃないかー！@k@vS12/00/00000221.　噂には聞いてるぜ！」
Main.TextENG: ``Hey!@k@vS12/00/00000220. Maebara boy!!@k@vS12/00/00000221. I heard what you did!``

Main.TextJPN: 「うんうん聞いたよ！@k@vS12/00/00000223.　何でもお魎の婆さんと日本刀ぶつけ合って納得させたって言うじゃないか！@k@vS12/00/00000224.　やるねぇ！！」
Main.TextENG: ``I heard about it too!@k@vS12/00/00000223. I heard you fought Oryou-san with a sword until she finally gave in!@k@vS12/00/00000224. Good on you!``

Main.TextJPN: 「そそ、そんなことしてないっす！@k@vS12/01/280100016.　平和に話し合いをしただけですよ…！」
Main.TextENG: ``I-I-I didn't do that...!@k@vS12/01/280100016. We just had a peaceful negotiation...!``

Main.TextJPN: 「しかし偉いな！@k@vS12/00/manC28002.　みんなを率いてお役所とちゃんと交渉したんだもんな！」
Main.TextENG: ``Still, I'm proud of you!@k@vS12/00/manC28002. You led everyone and actually negotiated with the center!``

Main.TextJPN: 「前原のお兄ちゃん、あんず飴サービスするよ！@k@vS12/00/manC28004.　何本いる？！」
Main.TextENG: ``Hey you, I'll give you some apricot candy!@k@vS12/00/manC28004. How many do you want?``

Main.TextJPN: 「圭一くん、いいないいな！@k@vS12/02/280200014.　今日はモテモテだね！」
Main.TextENG: ``Wow Keiichi-kun!@k@vS12/02/280200014. You're so popular today!``

Main.TextJPN: 「……圭一は熟した果実がお好きに違いないのです」
Main.TextENG: ``...I'm sure Keiichi is into old ladies, too.``

Main.TextJPN: 「梨花が何を言ってるかわかりませんが、どうせロクな意味ではありませんわね…」
Main.TextENG: ``I don't know what Rika's trying to say, and I don't even want to know...``

Main.TextJPN: 圭一も、行く先々で声を掛けられていた。
Main.TextENG: Keiichi got a lot of attention too, wherever he went.

Main.TextJPN: 沙都子を救うために率先して@rリーダーシップを取った功績は村中が知り、@rまた、町会やお魎をも説得したことは@r伝説的武勇伝となっていた。
Main.TextENG: In order to save Satoko, he took the initiative, and hence his leadership abilities were known throughout the village.@rMoreover, him persuading the village council and Oryou herself were now legendary tales of his heroism.

Main.TextJPN: それくらいに、誰もが、村全体が@r沙都子を冷遇していたことを知っていた。@rそしてそれがダム戦争が終わってなお続く@r理不尽なものであることも知っていた。
Main.TextENG: Everyone haad understood just how much Satoko had been ostracized by the whole village.@r@rAnd they also understood how unreasonable it was, for it to continue after the dam war was over.@rSeeing Keiichi's effort to break through that taboo so refreshingly, was a glimpse of a new future ahead for the village and his heroic deeds were praised by all, young and old.

Main.TextJPN: それを爽快に打ち破った圭一の活躍は、@r村の新しい未来を予感させるもので、@r老若を問わずにその英雄的行為を讃えた。
Main.TextENG: With that said, now Keiichi Maebara had become the hot topic amongst the Hinamizawan people.@rNaturally, everybody wanted a glimpse of this Maebara Keiichi,@rAnd hence the bargain action saw@ran unprecedent turnout.

Main.TextJPN: そんなわけで今や前原圭一は@r雛見沢中で話題が持ちきり。
Main.TextENG: Even though he started off red-faced, once he got over his shyness, Keiichi showed his true colors.

Main.TextJPN: 当然、噂の前原圭一を一目見ようと@r叩き売りオークションは@r空前の賑わいとなった。
Main.TextENG: Eliciting rapturous cheers from the crowd with sheer energy and momentum, The Watanagashi of Shouwa 58 of that day became home to a special fervor that was never before seen.

Main.TextJPN: 最初は真っ赤になってた圭一も、@r吹っ切れてからは本領発揮。
Main.TextENG: Now Keiichi has the admiration and recognition of the whole village.

Main.TextJPN: ノリと勢いだけで会場を沸かせ、@r昭和５８年の綿流しを一際、@r盛り上げて見せた。@r今や村中が圭一を讃え、評価していた。
Main.TextENG: Even after this, I'm sure Keiichi will continue to steer the village into new adventures to come.

Main.TextJPN: 圭一は今後も村を振り回して@r大活躍してくれるだろう。@r村の年寄りたちは、@rそういう若き牽引者が現れてくれたことを@r喜んでいるようだった。
Main.TextENG: Having such a young leader appear,@rhas made the village elders@rrather reassured.

Main.TextJPN: 「あ、昨日助けに来てくれたおじさん…！@k@vS12/01/280100018.　昨日はどうもありがとうございました！」
Main.TextENG: ``Oh, that's the guy who helped us yesterday...!@k@vS12/01/280100018. Thank you so very much for your assistance!``

Main.TextJPN: 「あー、紹介が遅れてるね。@k@vS12/03/280300024.県議会議員をされてる三郎叔父さんだよ。@k@vS12/03/280300025.こっちは市議会議員をされてる健叔父さん」
Main.TextENG: ``Oh, I should've introduced him to you then.@k@vS12/03/280300024. This is my uncle Saburou, who's in the prefectural assembly.@k@vS12/03/280300025. This is my other uncle Ken, and he's in the city council.``

Main.TextJPN: 「昨日は来るのが遅くなってすまんかったね！@k@vS12/00/0000275.　相談所への道を一本間違えちゃってなぁ、がっはっはっは！」
Main.TextENG: ``Sorry that we were late yesterday!@k@vS12/00/0000275. We got lost on our way there. Gah ha ha ha ha!``

Main.TextJPN: 「いやぁ、でも頼もしかったです！@k@vS12/06/280600009.　やっぱり議員は強いですねー！」
Main.TextENG: ``No, no, you both were a great help!@k@vS12/06/280600009. I was really impressed to see the power of elected officials!``

Main.TextJPN: 「住民の代わりに喧嘩をするのが仕事だからの！@k@vS12/00/0000282.　強くて当然だわい！」
Main.TextENG: ``Well, we're chosen to fight in place of the citizens!@k@vS12/00/0000282. Of course we're strong!``

Main.TextJPN: 「沙都子ちゃんも無事で本当に良かった。@k@vS12/00/00000286.これからは何かあったらいつでも相談してください。@k@vS12/00/00000287.必ず味方になりますよ！」
Main.TextENG: ``We're glad Satoko-chan is safe.@k@vS12/00/00000286. Talk to us again if there's anything you need.@k@vS12/00/00000287. We'll be glad to help!``

Main.TextJPN: そう頼もしく言いながら、彼らは沙都子の頭を撫でてくれた。
Main.TextENG: They rubbed Satoko's head while they spoke.

Main.TextJPN: 「あ、……ありがとうございますですわ…」
Main.TextENG: ``Th... Thank you very much...``

Main.TextJPN: 本部テントには、最後に駆けつけてくれた@r園崎家の大物たちがたくさんいた。
Main.TextENG: Back in the main tent, having been the last to rush in, were the many influential Sonozakis.

Main.TextJPN: 昨日世話になったばかりの人たちばかりだ。
Main.TextENG: They were all folk we became indebted to yesterday.

Main.TextJPN: 沙都子以外のみんなが頭を下げる。
Main.TextENG: Except Satoko, everyone bowed their heads.

Main.TextJPN: そこにいる人間たちは、つい先日まで、@r酒の席があったなら北条家を@r口汚く罵っていたかもしれない人たちだった。
Main.TextENG: Until just a few days ago, everyone present was someone who could have been bad-mouthing the Houjou family if they had sat down to drink.

Main.TextJPN: だが、圭一が全てそれらを打ち破った。
Main.TextENG: But Keiichi had broken through it all.

Main.TextJPN: 彼らは自分たちの軽率さを反省し、@r二度と沙都子を差別するようなことは@rしないだろう。
Main.TextENG: Having reflected upon their thoughtless insensitivities, I doubt any of these people will discriminate against Satoko again.

Main.TextJPN: 現に彼らは沙都子に頭を下げて@rこれまでを詫び、これからはどんなことでも@r力になると約束してくれた。
Main.TextENG: In fact, they bowed their heads, apologized for their actions, and promised their assistance if anything were to come up in the future.

Main.TextJPN: 「本当に立派なお子さんをお持ちで羨ましいですなぁ！」
Main.TextENG: ``You must be proud of your son!``

Main.TextJPN: 「いえいえ、圭一なんてとんでもない…！@k@vS12/00/282600002.　お！　圭一～！@k@vS12/00/282600003.　お父さんたちも来たぞ～！」
Main.TextENG: ``Oh, no, it's not really a big deal...!@k@vS12/00/282600002. Hey, Keiichi!@k@vS12/00/282600003. We're here too!``

Main.TextJPN: 「あー、圭一くんのご両親だー！」
Main.TextENG: ``Keiichi-kun's parents are here!

Main.TextJPN: 「こんばんは～！」
Main.TextENG: Good evening!``

Main.TextJPN: 「……初めましてなのです。@k@vS12/05/280500009.圭一のにゃーにゃーをしております、梨花なのです」
Main.TextENG: ``Nice to meet you.@k@vS12/05/280500009. I'm Keiichi's meow meow, Rika.``

Main.TextJPN: 「ど、どうも初めましてですわ。@k@vS12/04/280400011.北条沙都子と申します」
Main.TextENG: ``Nice to meet you.@k@vS12/04/280400011. My name is Satoko Houjou.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あなたが沙都子ちゃんね。@k@vS12/00/282700002.こんなに酷い怪我をして本当に可哀想に」
Main.TextENG: ``So you're Satoko-chan.@k@vS12/00/282700002. Such a poor little girl... look at her face!``

Main.TextJPN: 「今後も何かあったら圭一をぜひこき使ってやってください！@k@vS12/00/282600005.　それと引き換えと言っては何ですが、どうですかお嬢さん、ぜひ今度モデルに…！！」
Main.TextENG: ``You can make use of Keiichi if anything happens again!@k@vS12/00/282600005. In return... what would you think about modeling for me....?!``

Main.TextJPN: 「な、何だか監督と近い属性を感じるお父さまですわね…」
Main.TextENG: ``Y-Your father reminds me a bit of the coach...``
``Sorry...@k@vS12/01/280100020. That's just the kind of person he is...``

Main.TextJPN: 「でも、温かくて楽しそうなお父さまでしてよ…！」
Main.TextENG: ``Still, he seems very nice and fun to be around...!``

Main.TextJPN: 圭一の両親も祭りに来ていた。
今回の一件のヒーローの親ということで、@r立派なお子さんをお持ちでと@rちやほやされまくりのようだった。
Main.TextENG: They were made quite a fuss of for \"having such a magnificent son\", being the parents of today's big hero.

Main.TextJPN: 圭一に言わせると、両親は多忙を理由に@r家を出ないことが多かったので、これは@r両親と村に接点ができるいい機会らしい。
Main.TextENG: According to Keiichi, since his parents rarely left the house from being busy, this was a good chance for them to interact with the villagers.

Main.TextJPN: 圭一父は、町会でポスターの必要な時は@rぜひ自分にご用命をと胸を張っていた。
Main.TextENG: Keiichi's father had proudly volunteered to make posters for the town council, if the need ever arose.

Main.TextJPN: …圭一の話では、盗難が出るくらいの@rポスターを描くらしい。@rどんなポスターか愉しみだ。
Main.TextENG: ...I heard from Keiichi the posters his father makes are so good that people steal them.@r@rI look forward to seeing just what kind of posters they are.

Main.TextJPN: 「……こんな楽しい綿流しのお祭りは、僕も初めて見ますのです」
Main.TextENG: ``......This is the best Watanagashi festival I've ever had.``

Main.TextJPN: 「そうね。@k@vS12/05/280500011.…私も初めてよ。@k@vS12/05/280500012.…というか、あんたの方が長生きしてるんだもの。@k@vS12/05/280500013.あんたが初めてなら私にとっても初めてに決まってるじゃない」
Main.TextENG: ``Yes...@k@vS12/05/280500011. I feel the same way...@k@vS12/05/280500012. You've been around a lot longer than me.@k@vS12/05/280500013. If it's your best one, then it must be mine too.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……あぅあぅ。@k@vS12/12/281100002.でもきっと、綿流しという名前のお祭りになってからの中でも、一番賑やかで楽しいお祭りだと思いますのです」
Main.TextENG: ``...Au au.@k@vS12/12/281100002. Still, I think this is most fun and exciting festival we've had since it became known as Watanagashi.``

Main.TextJPN: 「そもそも綿流しのお祭りが、楽しいお祭りになったのはここ数年のことでしょう？@k@vS12/05/280500015.　明治以降は退屈な古手家の儀式だし。@k@vS12/05/280500016.それ以前は鷹野好みのお祭りだったはず」
Main.TextENG: ``The Watanagashi festival only became like this just a few years ago, didn't it?@k@vS12/05/280500015. It used to be just a boring traditional ceremony that the Furude family held.@k@vS12/05/280500016. And before that, it used to be something different, more like the things that Takano is interested in...``

Main.TextJPN: 「……あうあうあぅ」

Main.TextENG: ``Sorry...@k@vS12/05/280500018. I'll try not to be mean to you today.@k@vS12/05/280500019. Let's go have fun.@k@vS12/05/280500020. The both of us.@k@vS12/05/280500021. It's a special night for both me and you.``
